name: AT&T
tagline: Find a better deal on the same network quality

painPoints.title: Expensive Monthly Bills
painPoints.description: AT&T's unlimited plans start at $65/month and can exceed $85/month with fees and taxes.

painPoints.title: Long-Term Contracts
painPoints.description: Many customers are locked into 2-year agreements with early termination fees up to $325.

painPoints.title: Credit Check Required
painPoints.description: AT&T runs a hard credit check that can impact your credit score and may result in deposit requirements.

painPoints.title: Hidden Fees
painPoints.description: Activation fees, upgrade fees, and administrative charges add up quickly on your monthly bill.

alternatives.name: Vouch Mobile
switchReasons: Save over $500 per year on the same AT&T network
No credit check means instant approval
Month-to-month flexibility with no penalties
5G access included at no additional cost

faqs.question: Can I keep my phone number when switching from AT&T?
faqs.answer: Yes! You can port your existing AT&T phone number to any alternative carrier. The process typically takes a few minutes to a few hours. Make sure you don't cancel your AT&T service before initiating the port, as you'll need your account active to transfer the number.

faqs.question: Will my AT&T phone work with other carriers?
faqs.answer: Most AT&T phones are compatible with AT&T MVNOs like Vouch Mobile since they use the same network. For carriers on different networks (T-Mobile, Verizon), your phone needs to be unlocked and support their bands. AT&T will unlock your phone for free if it's paid off and you've had it for at least 60 days.

faqs.question: How do I get out of my AT&T contract?
faqs.answer: If you're under contract, you may face early termination fees (up to $325). However, you can avoid this by: paying off your device balance, waiting until your contract ends, or switching to a no-contract carrier like Vouch Mobile after your current term. AT&T no longer offers traditional 2-year contracts on most plans.

faqs.question: What's the best AT&T alternative for coverage?
faqs.answer: For identical coverage, choose an AT&T MVNO like Vouch Mobile or Cricket Wireless - they use the exact same towers. Vouch Mobile offers the best value at $30/month with no credit check, while Cricket has physical stores. If you're in urban areas, T-Mobile or Verizon MVNOs are also excellent options.

faqs.question: Will I lose coverage if I switch from AT&T?
faqs.answer: Not if you choose an AT&T MVNO! Carriers like Vouch Mobile use AT&T's same towers and network infrastructure, so you get identical coverage. The only difference is you pay less. For non-AT&T alternatives, coverage depends on that network's strength in your area.

name: Verizon
tagline: Same reliability, better price - find your perfect match

painPoints.title: Premium Pricing
painPoints.description: Verizon charges a premium for their network, with unlimited plans ranging from $70-$90/month before taxes.

painPoints.title: Device Payment Lock-in
painPoints.description: While there's no traditional contract, device payment plans can keep you tied to Verizon for 24-36 months.

painPoints.title: Hard Credit Checks
painPoints.description: Verizon requires a credit check that impacts your score and may require a deposit for those with limited credit.

painPoints.title: Complex Plan Tiers
painPoints.description: Multiple plan levels with different perks make it confusing to know if you're getting the best value.

alternatives.name: Vouch Mobile
switchReasons: Save over $600 annually compared to Verizon
AT&T network offers comparable nationwide coverage
No credit check or deposit required
Simple flat-rate pricing with no surprises

faqs.question: Can I port my Verizon number to another carrier?
faqs.answer: Absolutely! Your phone number belongs to you, not Verizon. When switching, simply provide your new carrier with your Verizon account number and PIN. Don't cancel Verizon until the port completes, which usually takes minutes to a few hours.

faqs.question: Will a Verizon phone work on AT&T's network?
faqs.answer: Most newer Verizon phones are unlocked and support multiple networks. Phones from 2020 onwards typically work on AT&T. Check that your phone supports AT&T's bands (2, 4, 5, 12, 14, 17, 29, 30, 66). Verizon will unlock your phone after 60 days of service.

faqs.question: What happens to my Verizon device payments if I switch?
faqs.answer: You'll need to pay off your remaining device balance or continue making payments. Verizon won't block your phone for switching, but the payments continue. Some carriers offer trade-in credits or bill credits to help offset this cost.

faqs.question: Is AT&T coverage as good as Verizon?
faqs.answer: AT&T and Verizon are both top-tier networks with 99%+ population coverage. AT&T actually has slightly more geographic coverage in rural areas. For most people, there's no noticeable difference in everyday use. Vouch Mobile gives you full AT&T coverage for $30/month.

faqs.question: What's the cheapest Verizon alternative with good coverage?
faqs.answer: For the same Verizon network, Visible offers plans from $25/month. However, Vouch Mobile at $30/month on AT&T's network provides better overall value with no data deprioritization and includes features like mobile hotspot that cost extra on Visible's basic plan.

name: T-Mobile
tagline: Great alternatives with even better value

painPoints.title: Rising Prices
painPoints.description: T-Mobile's prices have increased significantly since the Sprint merger, with unlimited plans now starting at $70/month.

painPoints.title: Rural Coverage Gaps
painPoints.description: Despite improvements, T-Mobile still has weaker coverage in rural areas compared to AT&T and Verizon.

painPoints.title: Credit Requirements
painPoints.description: T-Mobile runs credit checks and may require deposits, adding barriers for many customers.

painPoints.title: Network Congestion
painPoints.description: In some areas, T-Mobile's network can become congested during peak hours, slowing data speeds.

alternatives.name: Vouch Mobile
switchReasons: AT&T network has better rural coverage than T-Mobile
Save $40/month compared to T-Mobile unlimited
No credit check means everyone qualifies
Simpler pricing with no hidden fees

faqs.question: Can I use my T-Mobile phone on AT&T's network?
faqs.answer: Yes, most T-Mobile phones from 2019 onwards are compatible with AT&T. Your phone needs to be unlocked (T-Mobile unlocks devices after they're paid off) and support AT&T's LTE bands. iPhones and most Samsung Galaxy phones work seamlessly on both networks.

faqs.question: Will I get better coverage if I switch from T-Mobile?
faqs.answer: It depends on your location. AT&T generally has better rural and indoor coverage than T-Mobile. If you experience dropped calls or slow data in certain areas with T-Mobile, switching to an AT&T-based carrier like Vouch Mobile could significantly improve your experience.

faqs.question: How do I switch from T-Mobile without losing my number?
faqs.answer: Contact your new carrier to initiate a port request with your T-Mobile account number and PIN. The port typically completes within minutes. Don't cancel T-Mobile first - the port will automatically close your account once the number transfers.

faqs.question: Is T-Mobile's 5G better than AT&T's?
faqs.answer: Both networks offer excellent 5G coverage in urban areas. T-Mobile has more mid-band 5G (faster speeds), while AT&T has better low-band 5G (wider coverage). For everyday use, both provide significant speed improvements over 4G. Vouch Mobile includes 5G access on AT&T at no extra cost.

faqs.question: What's the best T-Mobile alternative for families?
faqs.answer: For families, Vouch Mobile offers the best per-line value at $30/month with no contracts. Unlike T-Mobile's family plans that require multiple lines for discounts, each Vouch line is independently priced. Mint Mobile also offers family savings with their bulk purchasing model.

name: Cricket Wireless
tagline: Keep AT&T coverage without Cricket's limitations

painPoints.title: 5G Costs Extra
painPoints.description: Unlike most competitors, Cricket charges additional fees for 5G access, making it more expensive to stay on the latest network technology.

painPoints.title: Data Deprioritization
painPoints.description: Cricket customers are always deprioritized behind AT&T postpaid customers, leading to slower speeds during peak usage times in busy areas.

painPoints.title: Limited Plan Flexibility
painPoints.description: Cricket's plans are rigid with limited customization options, and their cheapest plans have restrictive data caps of just 2-5GB.

painPoints.title: Streaming Quality Limits
painPoints.description: Video streaming is capped at SD quality (480p) on most Cricket plans, frustrating users who want HD content on their unlimited data.

alternatives.name: Vouch Mobile
switchReasons: 5G included free vs Cricket's extra charge
Save $25/month on unlimited compared to Cricket
Same AT&T network towers and coverage
No video streaming restrictions

faqs.question: Can I keep my phone number when switching from Cricket?
faqs.answer: Yes! You can port your Cricket phone number to any new carrier. The process is simple - just don't cancel Cricket before initiating the port. You'll need your Cricket account number and PIN, which you can find in your Cricket app or by calling customer service.

faqs.question: Will my Cricket phone work with Vouch Mobile?
faqs.answer: Since both Cricket and Vouch Mobile use the AT&T network, your Cricket phone will work seamlessly with Vouch Mobile. Cricket phones are typically unlocked if you've had service for at least 6 months, but even if locked, they should work fine on another AT&T MVNO.

faqs.question: Why do Cricket customers switch to other carriers?
faqs.answer: The top reasons Cricket customers switch include: paying extra for 5G access, experiencing slow speeds due to deprioritization during peak hours, wanting better unlimited plan pricing, and frustration with video streaming quality caps. Vouch Mobile solves all these issues on the same AT&T network.

faqs.question: Is Vouch Mobile really on the same network as Cricket?
faqs.answer: Yes! Both Vouch Mobile and Cricket are AT&T MVNOs, meaning they use the exact same cell towers and network infrastructure. You'll get identical coverage - the difference is Vouch Mobile offers better pricing and includes 5G at no extra charge.

faqs.question: How much can I save by switching from Cricket to Vouch Mobile?
faqs.answer: Cricket's unlimited plan costs $55/month, while Vouch Mobile's unlimited plan is just $30/month - that's $25/month in savings, or $300 per year. Plus, you get 5G included free with Vouch Mobile, which Cricket charges extra for.

painPoints.title: Large Upfront Payments
painPoints.description: Mint Mobile requires you to pay for 3, 6, or 12 months upfront to get advertised pricing. Their $15/month rate requires a full year payment of $180 at once.

painPoints.title: Price Jumps After Intro
painPoints.description: The heavily-advertised $15/month intro pricing doubles to $30/month after your first 3-month period, surprising many customers.

painPoints.title: Weaker Rural Coverage
painPoints.description: T-Mobile's network still lags behind AT&T in rural areas. If you travel or live outside major cities, you may experience coverage gaps.

painPoints.title: No True Month-to-Month
painPoints.description: Unlike truly flexible carriers, Mint Mobile doesn't offer genuine month-to-month billing - you must commit to at least 3 months minimum.

alternatives.name: Vouch Mobile
switchReasons: Pay monthly instead of 3-12 months upfront
Better rural coverage on AT&T network
Consistent $30/month with no price jumps
Cancel anytime without losing prepaid money

faqs.question: Can I switch from Mint Mobile before my prepaid period ends?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can switch anytime, but you won't get a refund for unused months. This is one reason many people prefer month-to-month carriers like Vouch Mobile - you only pay for what you use and can leave whenever you want.

faqs.question: Why do people leave Mint Mobile?
faqs.answer: Common reasons include: frustration with upfront payments, price increases after the intro period, T-Mobile's weaker rural coverage, and wanting more flexibility. Vouch Mobile addresses all these issues with true month-to-month billing on AT&T's superior rural network.

faqs.question: Will my Mint Mobile phone work with other carriers?
faqs.answer: Mint Mobile phones are typically unlocked. Most modern smartphones work on all major networks. If switching to an AT&T-based carrier like Vouch Mobile, verify your phone supports AT&T's bands - most iPhones and Samsung Galaxy phones from 2019 onwards will work.

faqs.question: Is Vouch Mobile's coverage better than Mint Mobile?
faqs.answer: In rural and suburban areas, yes. Vouch Mobile uses AT&T's network, which has significantly better coverage outside major cities compared to T-Mobile (Mint's network). In urban areas, both networks perform similarly.

faqs.question: How do I port my number from Mint Mobile?
faqs.answer: Get your Mint Mobile account number and transfer PIN from the Mint Mobile app or website. Provide these to your new carrier when signing up. Don't cancel Mint Mobile first - the port will automatically close your account. The transfer usually completes within minutes.

name: Metro by T-Mobile
tagline: Better value without the store visit

painPoints.title: Expensive Unlimited Plans
painPoints.description: Metro's unlimited plans cost $50-$60/month, significantly more than competitors offering similar features on comparable or better networks.

painPoints.title: Constant Data Deprioritization
painPoints.description: Metro customers are always deprioritized behind T-Mobile postpaid users, meaning slower speeds during busy times in congested areas.

painPoints.title: Rural Coverage Gaps
painPoints.description: Despite T-Mobile improvements, Metro still has weaker coverage in rural areas and some suburbs compared to AT&T-based carriers.

painPoints.title: In-Store Experience Required
painPoints.description: Many Metro transactions require visiting a physical store, adding inconvenience compared to fully online carriers with easy self-service.

alternatives.name: Vouch Mobile
features: Half the price of Metro unlimited
switchReasons: Save $30/month vs Metro's unlimited plan
Better rural coverage on AT&T network
Manage everything online - no store visits
Consistent speeds without deprioritization

faqs.question: Can I keep my Metro by T-Mobile phone number?
faqs.answer: Absolutely! Your phone number belongs to you, not Metro. When switching, provide your new carrier with your Metro account number and PIN. The port usually completes in minutes to a few hours. Don't cancel Metro before the port completes.

faqs.question: Will my Metro phone work on AT&T's network?
faqs.answer: Most Metro phones from 2019 onwards support multiple networks and will work on AT&T. Your phone needs to be unlocked (Metro unlocks phones after 180 days of active service) and support AT&T's LTE bands. iPhones and most Samsung Galaxy phones work seamlessly.

faqs.question: Why is Metro more expensive than other prepaid carriers?
faqs.answer: Metro charges a premium for their retail store presence and brand recognition. You're paying for the convenience of in-store support and phone deals. Online-first carriers like Vouch Mobile pass those savings to customers, offering similar or better service for less.

faqs.question: Is AT&T coverage better than Metro's T-Mobile network?
faqs.answer: In rural areas and many suburbs, yes. AT&T has traditionally stronger coverage outside major cities. In urban areas, both networks perform similarly. If you've experienced dead zones or weak signal with Metro, Vouch Mobile on AT&T may provide better coverage.

faqs.question: How much can I save switching from Metro to Vouch Mobile?
faqs.answer: Metro's unlimited plan costs $60/month while Vouch Mobile's unlimited is $30/month - a savings of $30/month or $360/year. You get better AT&T coverage and convenient online service, making the switch both cheaper and more convenient.

name: Visible
tagline: Better value without the deprioritization headaches

painPoints.title: Heavy Data Deprioritization
painPoints.description: Visible's basic $25/month plan has severe data deprioritization, making speeds painfully slow during peak hours in congested areas.

painPoints.title: Premium Plan Gets Expensive
painPoints.description: To avoid deprioritization, you need Visible+ at $45/month - nearly double the advertised base price and comparable to major carriers.

painPoints.title: Limited Hotspot on Basic
painPoints.description: The basic plan only includes 5GB of hotspot data, while competitors offer 15-20GB at similar price points.

painPoints.title: App-Only Customer Service
painPoints.description: Visible's app-based support can be frustrating when you have complex issues that need phone support or human interaction.

alternatives.name: Vouch Mobile
switchReasons: Consistent speeds without deprioritization issues
Better rural coverage than Verizon
More hotspot data at the same price point
Save $15/month vs Visible+ for similar experience

faqs.question: Why do people leave Visible for other carriers?
faqs.answer: The main complaints are severe data deprioritization causing slow speeds in busy areas, limited customer service options, and the higher price of Visible+ needed to avoid slowdowns. Vouch Mobile offers better value with consistent speeds on AT&T's network.

faqs.question: Will my Visible phone work on AT&T?
faqs.answer: Most phones purchased from Visible are unlocked and will work on AT&T. Modern smartphones support multiple networks. Check that your phone supports AT&T's LTE bands - most iPhones and flagship Android phones from 2019 onwards work on both networks.

faqs.question: Is Visible's deprioritization really that bad?
faqs.answer: In congested areas during peak hours, yes. Users report speeds dropping to under 1 Mbps, making basic tasks like loading web pages frustrating. This only affects the $25 basic plan - Visible+ at $45/month has better priority. Vouch Mobile avoids this issue entirely.

faqs.question: How does Vouch Mobile compare to Visible+?
faqs.answer: Vouch Mobile costs $30/month vs Visible+ at $45/month - a $15/month savings. Both offer similar features without deprioritization issues. The main difference is network: AT&T (Vouch) vs Verizon (Visible+). AT&T has slightly better rural coverage.

faqs.question: Can I port my Visible number to another carrier?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can transfer your number from Visible. Get your account number and PIN from the Visible app under Account settings. Provide these to your new carrier when signing up. The port typically completes in minutes. Don't cancel Visible before the transfer completes.

name: Boost Mobile
tagline: Simpler plans with consistent network quality

painPoints.title: Confusing Multi-Network Setup
painPoints.description: Boost operates on both T-Mobile and AT&T networks depending on your location and plan, creating confusion about what coverage you'll actually get.

painPoints.title: Inconsistent Plan Structure
painPoints.description: Boost frequently changes plans and pricing, making it hard to know if you're getting a good deal or what features are actually included.

painPoints.title: Data Deprioritization
painPoints.description: Like other prepaid carriers, Boost customers experience deprioritization during network congestion, leading to slower speeds when you need them most.

painPoints.title: Customer Service Challenges
painPoints.description: Boost has received numerous complaints about customer service quality, billing issues, and difficulty resolving problems.

alternatives.name: Vouch Mobile
switchReasons: Know exactly what network you're on - AT&T everywhere
Save $20/month vs Boost's unlimited plan
Simple pricing that doesn't change constantly
Better customer experience

faqs.question: What network is Boost Mobile actually on?
faqs.answer: Boost Mobile operates on both T-Mobile and AT&T networks, which varies by your location and the plan you choose. This can be confusing because you may not know which network you're using. Vouch Mobile keeps it simple - you're always on AT&T's network.

faqs.question: Can I keep my phone number when switching from Boost?
faqs.answer: Yes! Your phone number belongs to you. Get your Boost account number and PIN from the Boost app or by calling customer service. Provide these to your new carrier when signing up. Don't cancel Boost before the port completes.

faqs.question: Will my Boost phone work with other carriers?
faqs.answer: Boost phones are typically unlocked after 12 months of service. Most modern smartphones support multiple networks. For switching to Vouch Mobile (AT&T), verify your phone supports AT&T bands. iPhones and recent Samsung phones generally work on all networks.

faqs.question: Why do customers leave Boost Mobile?
faqs.answer: Common reasons include: confusion about which network they're using, frequent plan and pricing changes, customer service frustrations, and wanting a more straightforward carrier experience. Vouch Mobile offers clarity with dedicated AT&T service and simple pricing.

faqs.question: How much can I save by switching from Boost to Vouch Mobile?
faqs.answer: Boost's unlimited plan costs $50/month while Vouch Mobile is $30/month - saving you $20/month or $240/year. Plus you get the clarity of knowing you're always on AT&T's reliable network with consistent, predictable pricing.
